claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).
explanation: Composite figure with multiple panels showing hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibody titers (log₂ scale) at Day 0 and 1 month post-vaccination in Year 2 for four influenza strains (A/H3N2, A/H1N1pdm09, B/VIC, B/YAM). Each panel plots geometric mean titers with 95% CI for seven vaccination sequence arms: ccliV4-ccliV4, ccliV4-RIV4, RIV4-ccliV4, RIV4-RIV4, IIV4-ccliV4, IIV4-RIV4, IIV4-IIV4. P values indicate statistical comparisons between the IIV4-IIV4 (Fluzone) arm and other arms. does not support the claim because the figure shows Year 2 repeat‐vaccination arms comparing multiple vaccine sequences and does not present data from a pivotal trial directly comparing Flublok (RIV4) versus Fluarix (quadrivalent standard‐dose egg‐based IIV4). Note: The figure pertains to repeat vaccination in Year 2 and references IIV4 as Fluzone, not Fluarix; it does not explicitly address the pivotal trial comparison.
